result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis Lee Noah

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexis Lee Noah in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Alexis Lee Noah.  Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
2:59 p.m.
Copy of Information.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
3:01 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:10 pm.

3:36 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexis Lee Noah in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Alexis Lee Noah. 
Court heard - Deft now in courtroom.
Mother heard on late appearance today.
Atty Spansail heard - request bench warrant be quashed.
DA heard.
Court heard on bond form - instructing Deft to appear at all court dates.
3:42 pm Court recesses - Atty Spansail to discuss w/client.
4:20 pm Recess concludes.
Atty Spansail provides more argument to quash bench warrant.
Brooke Hilsbeck in court from MHHS and heard.
DA heard.
Court addresses Deft.
Court quashes warrant and proceeds w/prelim waiver today.
Atty Spansail provides form, satisfied Deft understands.
Def waives prelim
Court finds def freely waives prelim and binds over for trial.
Court schedules w/parties.
Court heard - this matter is to be the first case called at next hearing to assure Defts prompt attendance.
4:31 pm
Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:06 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexis Lee Noah not in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Alexis Lee Noah. 
Court heard on phone call from Deft today.
Atty Spansail heard - unsure of Defts whereabouts.
DA heard - confirmed w/DHS, no meeting today, requests bench warrant.
Court authorizes bench warrant.
3:09 pm

9:12 AM Defendant Alexis Lee Noah in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Alexis Lee Noah.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed complaints with Deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim.
Deft waives time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
9:14 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:57 AM Defendant Alexis Lee Noah appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Deft heard - does not have a copy of the complaint and has not yet seen it.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $5,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact with known drug users or sellers, may not go to the State of Michigan for any reason. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
10:03 AM
10:08 back on record.
Court heard - has provided the wrong hearing date.
CO heard - is unable to get the deft back in the video room right now due to a problem with another deft in the jail.
Court reschedules with parties.
CO will provide the new date to the deft, when time allows.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
